Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110609 Firefox/7.0a1

Ubuntu 11.04 introduced the possibility of maximizing a window by dragging it to the right, left or top of the screen (similar action to what windows 7 does). Although this action works perfectly when dragging the windowed webconsole to the left part of the screen it does not work or does not work correctly for top and right parts.

Reproducible: always

Steps to reproduce:
 1. Start Webconsole (CTRL+SHIFT+K)
 2. From the Position menu (within the webconsole) choose window
 3. Drag Webconsole window to the right part of the screen

Actual results:
 - webconsole is maximized only to be resized and repositioned by itself

Expected results:
 - webconsole occupies the right-half of the screen

I can reproduce with
Aurora nightly Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0a2) Gecko/20110610 Firefox/6.0a2
on Debian Squeeze/Wheezy with GNOME with Metacity ≈2.30.

For it to happen, you need to:
* have Web Console on the right end of the screen
* have some activity in the console, or even just some activity in chrome (e.g. show Awesomebar drop-down).
